title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, goals, and requirements. Gather input from stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand the needs and constraints for the knowledge graph visualization tool.

title: Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data model, user interface, and backend components. Define the technology stack and integration points.

title: Knowledge Graph Data Modeling
description: Design the data model for representing the knowledge graph, including entities, relationships, and associated metadata. The data model should support efficient storage, retrieval, and querying of the knowledge graph data. Consider factors such as scalability, performance, and data integrity.

title: User Interface Design for Interactive Knowledge Graph Visualization Tool
description: Design an intuitive and efficient user interface for the knowledge graph visualization tool, ensuring ease of navigation, effective query formulation, and meaningful interaction patterns. Consider edge cases, accessibility, performance optimizations, and adherence to design principles. Include wireframes or mockups in your proposal.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the backend components, including the knowledge graph data store, query processing, and API endpoints.

title: Frontend Development
description: Implement the user interface for the knowledge graph visualization tool, including rendering, interaction, and integration with the backend.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute testing strategies, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing. Ensure the application meets quality standards and requirements.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Assess and mitigate security risks, implement access controls, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure, automate the build and release processes, and configure monitoring and logging.

title: Documentation and User Support
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the application, including user guides, technical documentation, and support resources.
